metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20257 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An infinite loop flaw was found in the e1000 NIC emulator of the QEMU. This issue occurs while processing transmits (tx) descriptors in process_tx_desc if various descriptor fields are initialized with invalid values. This flaw allows a guest to consume CPU cycles on the host, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Alexander Bulekov, Cheolwoo Myung, Sergej Schumilo, Cornelius Aschermann, Simon Werner

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
